name: Generic Application Launcher
description:
This tool launches a specified application to open a designated file or directory.
You provide the path to the executable (e.g., 'notepad.exe', 'C:\Program Files\RStudio\rstudio.exe'), the path to the file or directory you want it to open (e.g., 'path_to\personal_notes.txt', 'path_to\R_project_directory'), and any optional additional command-line arguments.
The tool reports success, the process ID (PID), and the command executed.

Prompt Examples:

1. Open a text file with Notepad (Windows)

To open the text file C:\Users\YourUser\Documents\personal_notes.txt using notepad.exe:

executable_path: "notepad.exe"
file_to_open_path: "C:\\Users\\YourUser\\Documents\\personal_notes.txt"
additional_args: []

2. Open an R project directory with RStudio (Windows)

To open the R project located in the directory D:\Work\R_Projects\Customer_Churn_Analysis using a specific RStudio installation:

executable_path: "C:\\Program Files\\RStudio\\rstudio.exe"
file_to_open_path: "D:\\Work\\R_Projects\\Customer_Churn_Analysis"
additional_args: []

3. Open a document with LibreOffice Writer (Windows)

To open the document C:\Shared\TeamReports\Q3_Summary.docx using a specific LibreOffice Writer installation, perhaps with an argument to open it read-only (if supported, e.g., --view or similar, specific arguments depend on the application):

executable_path: "C:\\Program Files\\LibreOffice\\program\\swriter.exe"
file_to_open_path: "C:\\Shared\\TeamReports\\Q3_Summary.docx"
additional_args: ["--view"]
(Note: --view is an example; actual read-only flags vary by application. For simple opening, [] is fine.)

4. Open an image file with Microsoft Paint (Windows)

To open the image C:\MyPictures\Holiday\beach.jpg using mspaint.exe:

executable_path: "mspaint.exe"
file_to_open_path: "C:\\MyPictures\\Holiday\\beach.jpg"
additional_args: []

5. Open an R script with RStudio and additional options (assuming 'rstudio' is in PATH)

To open the R script /home/data_scientist/projects/my_analysis_v2.R using the rstudio command, without restoring the previous workspace or environment:

executable_path: "rstudio"
file_to_open_path: "/home/data_scientist/projects/my_analysis_v2.R"
additional_args: ["--no-restore-workspace", "--no-environ"]
author: hanzo.ai
